body:
Already done for daemonsets, we should do the same for deployments:
```
$ kc get ds -n kube-system 
NAME                   DESIRED   CURRENT   READY     NODE-SELECTOR   AGE
checkpoint-installer   1         1         1         master=true     42m
kube-apiserver         1         1         1         master=true     42m
kube-proxy             2         2         2         <none>          42m
$ kc get ds -n kube-system -o wide
NAME                   DESIRED   CURRENT   READY     NODE-SELECTOR   AGE       CONTAINER(S)           IMAGE(S)                                                                   SELECTOR
checkpoint-installer   1         1         1         master=true     42m       checkpoint-installer   quay.io/coreos/pod-checkpointer:b4f0353cc12d95737628b8815625cc8e5cedb6fc   k8s-app=pod-checkpoint-installer
kube-apiserver         1         1         1         master=true     42m       kube-apiserver         quay.io/coreos/hyperkube:v1.5.1_coreos.0                                   k8s-app=kube-apiserver
kube-proxy             2         2         2         <none>          42m       kube-proxy             quay.io/coreos/hyperkube:v1.5.1_coreos.0                                   k8s-app=kube-proxy
$ kc get deploy -n kube-system 
NAME                      DESIRED   CURRENT   UP-TO-DATE   AVAILABLE   AGE
kube-controller-manager   2         2         2            2           43m
kube-dns                  1         1         1            1           43m
kube-scheduler            2         2         2            2           43m
$ kc get deploy -n kube-system -o wide
NAME                      DESIRED   CURRENT   UP-TO-DATE   AVAILABLE   AGE
kube-controller-manager   2         2         2            2           43m
kube-dns                  1         1         1            1           43m
kube-scheduler            2         2         2            2           43m
```
@kubernetes/sig-cli-misc

title: Include more info about deployments in `get -o wide`
